intro: Crinipes longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved crinipes, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along riverbanks and coastal areas. Crinipes longifolius is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
